document_title: Breast cancer stage 0: Don't be subjective in the pre-cancer stage
subsection_name: ung-thu-vu-giai-doan-0.json_1_Explanation of T, N, M classification in stage 0 breast cancer
subsection_content:
The breast cancer staging system is the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) TNM system.
The TNM staging system is based on the size and spread of the tumor (T = Tumor), metastasis to lymph nodes (N = Node) and metastasis to other parts of the body ( M = Metastasis). The numbers or letters following T, N and M provide detailed information about these elements. (3)
According to TNM, stage 0 can be grouped as follows:
Tis: Indicates carcinoma in situ (DCIS, or Paget's disease of the breast).; N0: Cancer has not spread to nearby lymph nodes; M0: cancer has not spread to other parts of the body.
Once determined, the T N and M factors will be combined and give an overall stage of 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4.
